info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 6:59PM EDT until July 28 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland OH
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following counties, Ashland, Huron and Richland.
* WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is already occurring in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashland, Norwalk, Bellevue, Willard, New London, Plymouth, Milan, Wakeman, Savannah, Polk, Sullivan, Greenwich, Monroeville, Jeromesville, North Fairfield, Bailey Lakes, Shenandoah, Olivesburg, Nova and Nankin.
- Please visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Ashland, OH; Huron, OH; Richland, OH
